text: Yes, and if you want, you can add the subtitles in French because this video is going to be in French and English.
We wish you a great Carnaval!
The first edition of the Carnaval took place in 1894, but it’s only since 1955 that the Carnaval is celebrated every year.
They created Carnaval to warm our hearts during the cold winter.
How about you Nadine, is it warming your heart?
Yes, yes really warm!
yes
yes
Don’t be surprised, from now on, you are going to see a new person in this video.
This is my girlfriend Valerie.
She is also part of our project ‘’PRETS pour la route’’, which is our Youtube Channel.
So Welcome Valerie to this video!
Hello everyone!
It’s ‘’Poutine Week’’ in Quebec so I picked the ‘’Poutine Week’’ special, just like Matt.
We have a Pulled Pork Poutine, with green onions and BBQ Sauce.
It looks so good!
We are going to see a canoe race on ice today, it should be really impressive!
We are going to visit the ‘’Petit Champlain’’ area and we are going to see the St-Jean street.
A lot of activities, it’s going to be an awesome day!
You can see behind me the magnificent fresco that relates to all of Quebec City’s history.
We can see historical figures such as Jacques Cartier and Samuel de Champlain.
here are also references to the modern era of the city with Peter Stastny.
The great thing is that you can even be part of history!
Come with me Nadine, we are going to pose!
We just arrived in Old Quebec.
We are going to see the City Hall, the St-Jean street and we will visit Boutiques.
We are going to have some fun this afternoon!
Quebec City is the only fortified city north of Mexico!
This is maple taffy!
It starts by tapping a maple tree to extract maple water, and then we boil the maple water to create maple syrup
and then we boil it a little more to create maple taffy.
If we would heat it even more, we could make maple butter, maple sugar or maple candies.
We can make a lot of different recipes.
So now we can taste it?
yes
Is this one ready?
Yes!
Today, we are on Orleans Island which is about a 15 minute drive from Quebec City.
This is the area where we grow most of our fruits and vegetables.
We also have a lot of maple trees and great sugar cabins to visit.
There are a lot of wonderful houses with great river views.
Today we are here to go dog sledding, right?
Yes!
Montmorency Falls!
These falls are higher than Niagara Falls.
The part on your right is called Sugar Bread. It’s frozen water!
Goodbye Quebec City!
You’ve been very good to us!
